posts.post_content:
Posted By: jay wolt
Have 4 SGC pedigreed cards for sale
all prices are dlvd and Paypal is OK, no fee

1911 T206 John McGraw portrait w/ cap SGC-50 (Lionel Carter) SOLD!

1915 Cracker Jack Chief Bender Baltimore Feds SGC-40(Frank Nagy)$340.

1956 Topps Harmon Killebrew SGC-84(Lionel Carter) SOLD!

1962 Whitey Ford SGC-A (Whitey Ford)$185.

[IMG]http://www.qualitycards.com/pictures/4sale.jpg[/IMG]

[IMG]http://www.qualitycards.com/pictures/4saleb.jpg[/IMG]

Posted By: Russ Bright
DO you know or can tell us why the Whitey ford was graded Authentic? was this at Whitey's request?

Posted By: jay wolt
Russ - not sure why it wasn't given a numerical grade.
There were 7 different Topps cards auctioned of by Hunt
in NYC the day of the All Star Game at Yankee Stadium.
Which Ford, Reggie, Yogi & Goose threw out the 1st pitch.

I doub't Ford had these cards in his collection slabbed.
Hunt probably had them slabbed w/ the pedigree as opposed to
auctioning them in top loaders. Hunt also auctiond off a bunch
of Whitey's plaques, awards & momentos.

Since the '62 Ford is well worn, it really doesn't matter in
value if its graded a 30 or authentic. Its not like Ford had 
a dozen of each year, just 7 different Topps and a couple of
Bowmans.

Posted By: jay wolt
The McGraw T206 has been SOLD
The remaining cards have been discounted
